get.summary: Fetch details of products.
get.description: Returns a list of a team's products and their details.

post.summary: Create a new product for a team.
post.description: Create a new product for a team. Newly created team has a `type` and a `name` as required variables, and optionally a `description` and a `changelog`.

get.summary: Fetch details of a product.
get.description: Returns a products' details. The response should contain an array, consisting of the product's `name`, `id`, `type`, `description`, `deletability`, versions and version related data, including version `name` and `id`, `changelog`, increasibility.

put.description: Updates a product. `Name` is a required variable to identify which product is modified, `description` and `changelog` can be adjusted with this call.

delete.description: Deletes a product. Only the `name` is required.

get.summary: Fetch the details of all the versions under a product.
get.description: Returns an array containing the details of every version that belong to a product. `ProductId` refers to the product's ID. Details include the version's `name`, `id`, `type`, `audit` log details, `changelog`, and increasibility.

200.description: Returns an array with the data of every version of a product.

post.description: Creates a new version to a product. `ProductId` refers to the product's ID. Request must include the `name` and `type` of the version, `changelog` is optionable. Response should include the `name`, `id`, `changelog`, increasibility, `type`, and `audit` log details of the version.

get.summary: Retrieve the details of a version of a product.
get.description: Returns an array containing the details of every version that belong to a product. `ProductId` refers to the product's ID, `versionId` refers to the version's ID. Details include the version's `name`, `id`, `type`, `audit` log details, `changelog`, increasibility, mutability, deletability, and all image related data, including `name`, `id`, `tag`, `order` and configuration data of the images.

200.description: Details of a version under a product is fetched.

put.description: Updates a version's `changelog`. `ProductId` refers to the product's ID, `versionId` refers to the version's ID. Both are required variables.

204.description: Changelog of a version is updated.

delete.description: This call deletes a version. `ProductId` refers to the product's ID, `versionId` refers to the version's ID. Both are required variables.

put.summary: Turn version into a default one of the complex product other versions under it will inherit images from.
put.description: This call turns a version into a default one, resulting other versions within this product later inherit images and configurations from it. `ProductId` refers to the product's ID, `versionId` refers to the version's ID. Both are required variables.

post.summary: Increase a default version of a complex product with a new version.
post.description: Increases the default version of a product with a new version. `ProductId` refers to the product's ID, `versionId` refers to the version's ID, `name` refers to the name of the new version. All are required variables.

get.summary: Fetch data of all images of a version.
get.description: Fetch details of images within a version. `ProductId` refers to the product's ID, `versionId` refers to the version's ID. Both are required variables.</br></br>Details come in an array, including `name`, `id`, `tag`, `order`, and config details of the image.

post.summary: Add an image to a version.
post.description: Add new image to a version. `ProductId` refers to the product's ID, `versionId` refers to the version's ID, `registryId` refers to the registry's ID, `images` refers to the name(s) of the images you'd like to add. All are required variables.

get.summary: Fetch data of an image of a version.
get.description: Fetch details of an images within a version. `ProductId` refers to the product's ID, `versionId` refers to the version's ID, `imageId` refers to the image's ID. All are required variables.</br></br>Details come in an array, including `name`, `id`, `tag`, `order`, and config details of the image.

patch.summary: Configure an image of a version.
patch.description: Modify and add configuration variables of an image. `ProductId` refers to the product's ID, `versionId` refers to the version's ID, `imageId` refers to the image's ID. All are required variables. `Tag` refers to the version of the image, `config` is an array of configuration variables.

delete.summary: Delete an image from a version.
delete.description: Delete an image. `ProductId` refers to the product's ID, `versionId` refers to the version's ID, `imageId` refers to the image's ID. All are required variables.

204.description: Delete an image from a version.

put.summary: Edit image deployment order of a version.
put.description: Edit image deployment order of a version. `ProductId` refers to the product's ID, `versionId` refers to the version's ID. Both are required variables. Request should include the names of images in an array.

get.summary: Fetch data of registries.
get.description: Lists the details of every registries available. Response is an array including the `name`, `id`, `type`, `description`, and `icon` of the registry.</br></br>Registries are 3rd party registries where the images of versions are located.

200.description: Data of all registries within a team listed.

post.description: To add a new registry, include the `name`, `type`, `description`, `details`, and `icon`. `Type`, `details`, and `name` are required. Response is an array including the `name`, `id`, `type`, `description`, `imageNamePrefix`, `inUse`, `icon`, and audit log info of the registry.

get.summary: Fetch data of a registry.
get.description: Lists the details of a registry. `RegistryId` refers to the registry's ID. Response is an array including the `name`, `id`, `type`, `description`, `imageNamePrefix`, `inUse`, `icon`, and audit log info of the registry.

put.summary: Modify the details of a registry.
put.description: Modify the `name`, `type`, `description`, `details`, and `icon`. `RegistryId` refers to the registry's ID. `RegistryId`, `type`, `details`, and `name` are required.

delete.description: To delete a registry from dyrectorio, only `RegistryId`, `type`, `details`, and `name` are required.

get.summary: Fetch data of teams the user is a member of.
get.description: Data of teams consist of `name`, `id`, and `statistics`, including number of `users`, `products`, `nodes`, `versions`, and `deployments`.</br></br>Teams are the shared entity of multiple users. The purpose of teams is to separate users, nodes and products based on their needs within an organization. Team owners can assign roles. More details about teams here.

post.description: Request must include `name`, which is going to be the name of the newly made team. Response should include `name`, `id`, and `statistics`, including number of `users`, `products`, `nodes`, `versions`, and `deployments`.

get.summary: Fetch data of a team the user is a member of.
get.description: Request must include `teamId`, which is the ID of the team they'd like to get the data of. Data of teams consist of `name`, `id`, and `statistics`, including number of `users`, `products`, `nodes`, `versions`, and `deployments`. Response should include user details, as well, including `name`, `id`, `role`, `status`, `email`, and `lastLogin`.

200.description: Data of the team is listed.

put.description: Request must include `teamId` and `name`. Admin access required for successful request.

delete.description: Request must include `teamId`. Owner access required for successful request.

post.summary: Add new user to a team.
post.description: Request must include `teamId`, email and `firstName`. Admin access required for successful request.</br></br>Response should include new user's `name`, `id`, `role`, `status`, `email`, and `lastLogin`.

put.description: Request must include `teamId`, `userId` and `role`. Admin access required for successful request.

delete.description: Request must include `teamId`, `userId`. Admin access required for successful request.

post.summary: Reinvite user with a pending invite status to a team.
post.description: This call sends a new invitation link to a user who hasn't accepted invitation to a team.</br></br>Request must include `teamId`, `userId`. Admin access required for successful request.
Response includes the `user`, `activeTeamId`, `teams`, and `invitations`.
Request must include `teamID`.
Request must include `teamID`.

get.summary: Fetch data of deployments.
get.description: Get details of deployments. Deployment details should include `id`, `prefix`, `status`, `note`, `audit` log details, product `name`, `id`, `type`, version `name`, `type`, `id`, and node `name`, `id`, `type`.

post.description: Request must include `versionId`, `nodeId`, and `prefix`, which refers to the ID of a deployed container. Response should include deployment `id`, `prefix`, `status`, `note`, and `audit` log details, as well as product `type`, `id`, `name`, version `type`, `id`, `name`, and node `type`, `id`, `name`.

get.summary: Retrieve data of a deployment.
get.description: Get details of a certain deployment. Request must include `deploymentId`. Deployment details should include `id`, `prefix`, `environment`, `status`, `note`, `audit` log details, product `name`, `id`, `type`, version `name`, `type`, `id`, and node `name`, `id`, `type`.

200.description: Data of a deployment is listed.

get.summary: Fetch event log of a deployment.
get.description: Request must include `deploymentId`. Response should include `type`, `deploymentStatus`, `createdAt`, `log`, and `containerState` which consists of `state` and `instanceId`.

get.summary: Get details of a deployed container.
get.description: Request must include `deploymentId` and `instanceId`, which refers to the ID of a deployed container. Response should include `state`, `id`, `updatedAt`, and `image` details including `id`, `name`, `tag`, `order` and `config` variables.

patch.description: Request must include `deploymentId` and `instanceId`. Response should include `config` variables in an array.

get.summary: Fetch secrets of a deployed container.
get.description: Request must include `deploymentId` and `instanceId`, which refers to the ID of a deployed container. Response should include container `prefix` and `name`, and `publicKey`, `keys`.

200.description: Secrets of a deployed container listed.

post.description: Request must include `deploymentId`.

Request must include `deploymentId` and `force`, which is a boolean variable. Response should include deployment data: `id`, `prefix`, `status`, `note`, and miscellaneous details of `audit` log, `product`, `version`, and `node`.

get.summary: Retrieve access token.
get.description: Access token's support is to provide secure access to a user's profile.

post.description: Request must include `name` and `expirationInDays`.

get.summary: Fetch token details.
get.description: Access token's details are `name`, `id`, and the time of creation and expiration. Request must include `tokenId`.

get.summary: Get data of nodes that belong to your team.
get.description: Fetch data of deployment targets. Response should include an array with the node's `type`, `status`, `description`, `icon`, `address`, `connectedAt` date, `version`, `updating`, `id`, and `name`.

post.description: Request must include the node's `name`. Response should include an array with the node's `type`, `status`, `description`, `icon`, `address`, `connectedAt` date, `version`, `updating`, `id`, and `name`.

get.summary: Get data of nodes that belong to your team.
get.description: Fetch data of a specific node. Request must include `nodeId`. Response should include an array with the node's `type`, `status`, `description`, `icon`, `address`, `connectedAt` date, `version`, `updating`, `id`, `name`, `hasToken`, and agent installation details.

200.description: Data of the node is listed.

put.description: Request must include the node's `name`, body can include `description` and `icon`.

post.description: Request must include `nodeId`, `type` and `scriptType`.

delete.summary: Delete node set up install script.

get.summary: Fetch install script.
get.description: Request must include `nodeId`. Response should include `type`, `status`, `description`, `icon`, `address`, `connectedAt` date, `version`, `updating`, `id`, `name`, `hasToken`, and `install` details.

delete.summary: Revoke token that belongs to a node's install script.

post.description: Request must include `nodeId`.

post.summary: Start a container deployed with dyrectorio on a node.
post.description: Request must include `nodeId`, `prefix`, and `name`.

post.summary: Stop a container deployed with dyrectorio on a node.
post.description: Request must include `nodeId`, `prefix`, and `name`.

post.summary: Restart a container deployed with dyrectorio on a node.
post.description: Request must include `nodeId`, `prefix`, and `name`.

delete.summary: Delete containers deployed with dyrectorio on a node.
Delete a container deployed with dyrectorio on a node.

get.summary: Fetch data of containers running on a node.
get.description: Request must include `nodeId` and `prefix`. Response should include `id`, `command`, `createdAt`, `state`, `status`, `imageName`, `imageTag` and `ports` of images.

200.description: Fetch data of containers running on a node.

post.summary: Start any container on a node.
post.description: Request must include `nodeId`, and the `name` of the container.

post.summary: Stop any container on a node.
post.description: Request must include `nodeId`, and the `name` of the container.

post.summary: Restart any container on a node.
post.description: Request must include `nodeId`, and the `name` of the container.

delete.summary: Delete any container from a node.
delete.description: Request must include `nodeId`, and the `name` of the container.

get.summary: Fetch audit log.
get.description: Request must include `skip`, `take`, and dates of `from` and `to`. Response should include an array of `items`: `createdAt` date, `userId`, `email`, `serviceCall`, and `data`.

get.summary: Return service status of the platform.
get.description: Response should include `status`, `version` of the platform and `lastMigration` of database.

get.summary: Retrieve notifications that belong to a team.
get.description: Response should include `type`, `id`, `name`, `url`, `active`, and `creatorName`.

post.description: Request must include `type`, `enabledEvents`, `id`, `name`, `url`, and `active`. Response should list `type`, `enabledEvents`, `id`, `name`, `url`, `active`, and `creatorName`.

get.summary: Fetch details of a notification.
get.description: Request must include `notificationId` parameter. Response should include `type`, `enabledEvents`, `id`, `name`, `url`, `active`, and `creatorName`.

put.description: Request must include `notificationId`, `type`, `enabledEvents`, `id`, `name`, `url`, and `active`. Response should include `type`, `enabledEvents`, `id`, `name`, `url`, `active`, and `creatorName`.

post.description: Request must include `notificationId`.

get.summary: Return details of templates on the platform.
get.description: Response should include `id`, `name`, `description` and `technologies` of templates.

post.summary: Creates a new product from the selected template.
post.description: Request must include `type`, `id`, and `name`. Response should include `id`, `name`, `description`, `type`, and `audit` log details of templates.

get.summary: Retrieves the image of the template
get.description: Request must include `templateId`.

200.description: Retrieve data of an image of a template.

get.summary: Fetch dashboard data of latest activities.
get.description: Response should include `users`, number of `auditLogEntries`, `products`, `versions`, `deployments`, `failedDeployments`, details of `nodes`, `latestDeployments` and `auditLog` entries.

get.summary: Fetch details of storages.
get.description: Response should include `description`, `icon`, `url`, `id`, and `name`.

post.description: Request must include `name`, and `url`. Request body may include `description`, `icon`, `accesKey`, and `secretKey`. Response should include `description`, `icon`, `url`, `id`, `name`, `accessKey`, `secretKey`, and `inUse`.

get.summary: Fetch the name and ID of storages.
get.description: Response should include `id`, and `name`.

200.description: Name and ID of storages listed.

get.summary: Return details of a storage.
get.description: Request must include `storageId`. Response should include description, icon, url, `id`, `name`, `accessKey`, `secretKey`, and `inUse`.

put.description: Request must include `storageId`, `name`, and `url`. Request body may include `description`, `icon`, `accesKey`, and `secretKey`.

tags.name: products
tags.description: There are two kinds of products in dyrectorio: Simple and Complex. Simple products make up one deployable unit without versioning, while Complex products come with multiple rolling or incremental versions. More details in dyrectorio platform [documentation](https://docs.dyrector.io/tutorials/create-your-product).

tags.name: versions
tags.description: Versions belong to products. While Simple Products are technically versionless, they act as a rolling version of a Complex Product.</br></br>The purpose of versions is to separate different variations of your product. They can be either rolling or incremental. One Complex Product can have multiple versions of both types. More details about rolling and incremental versions in dyrectorio platform [documentation](https://docs.dyrector.io/get-started/components#product).

tags.name: version/images
tags.description: Images make up a Complex Product's version, or a Simple Product.

tags.name: registries
tags.description: Registries are 3rd party registries where the images of versions are located. Learn more about registries in dyrectorio platform [documentation](https://docs.dyrector.io/get-started/components#registry).

tags.name: teams
tags.description: Teams are the shared entity of multiple users. The purpose of teams is to separate users, nodes and products based on their needs within an organization. Team owners can assign roles. More details about teams in dyrectorio platform [documentation](https://docs.dyrector.io/get-started/components#team).

tags.name: users/me
tags.description: users/me cover endpoints related to your user profile.

tags.name: deployments
tags.description: Deployments are the process that gets the installation of your versions or Simple Products done on the node of your choice. More details about deployments in dyrectorio platform [documentation](https://docs.dyrector.io/get-started/components#deployment).

tags.name: tokens
tags.description: Tokens are the access tokens that grant you access to a user profile and the teams the profile is a member of.

tags.name: nodes
tags.description: Nodes are the deployment targets. Nodes are registered by installing at least one of the agents - crane for Kubernetes, dagent for Docker. These agents connect the platform to your node. One team can have as many nodes as they like.</br></br>Node installation takes place with Shell or PowerShell scripts, which can be created or revoked. More details in dyrectorio platform [documentation](https://docs.dyrector.io/get-started/components#node).

tags.name: audit-log
tags.description: Audit log is a log of team activity generated by the platform.

tags.name: health
tags.description: Health refers to the status of the different services that make up the platform. It can be checked to see if the platform works properly.

tags.name: notifications
tags.description: Notifications are chat notifications in Slack, Discord, and Teams. They send an automated message about deployments, new versions, new nodes, and new users. More details in dyrectorio platform [documentation](https://docs.dyrector.io/tutorials/create-chat-notifications).

tags.name: templates
tags.description: Templates are preset applications that can be turned into a product right away. They can be deployed with minimal configuration. More details about templates in dyrectorio platform [documentation](https://docs.dyrector.io/features/templates).

tags.name: dashboard
tags.description: Dashboard summarizes the latest activities of a team.

tags.name: storages
tags.description: Storages are S3 compatible memory storages. They can be used for file injection. More details in dyrectorio platform [documentation](https://docs.dyrector.io/features/storage).

jwt.description: Please enter token in following format:
